Vocabularies.Definition: n. (infml)  a taxi driver
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Cabbie, how far is it to Johnson Street?

Vocabularies.Definition: be absorbed in, be fully occupied with 专心致志于
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He was lost in thought, staring at the book in front of him.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. (AmE) the glass window in the front of a car, truck, etc. (汽车的)挡风玻璃
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. Since I couldn't find my friend, I wrote him a note and stuck it on the windshield of his car.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  a taxi 出租车
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. The cabs were lined up outside the station.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. able to be used, had or reached 可用的;可得到的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. Details of the competition are available from our head office.

Vocabularies.Definition: ad. showing or saying that one is sorry for some fault or wrong 道歉地,带着歉意地
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. Finally the boy's parents appeared and gave him a hug apologetically.

Vocabularies.Definition: (infml) (used when you are not very sure about what you have just said) 诸如此类的事
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. Here's some money. Get yourself a sandwich or something.

Vocabularies.Definition: continue; begin
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. "Could I ask you a rather personal question?" "Of course, go ahead."

Vocabularies.Definition: memorize, remember exactly 记住，能背出
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. The pupils were required to learn the poems by heart.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. form a judgement about 估计
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. We haven't estimated the proper price for the contract yet.

Vocabularies.Definition: 不妨,(也)无妨
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. The weather was so bad we might (just) as well have stayed at home.

Vocabularies.Definition: not a good 不太好的 e.g. He is not much of a father, but he is an outstanding professor.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: continue without stopping 保持 e.g. They risk losing their homes because they can no longer keep up the repayments.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  the act of writing, receiving or sending letters; letters 通信(联系);信件
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. His interest in writing came from a long correspondence with a close friend.

Vocabularies.Definition: ad. almost
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The holidays are practically over; there's only one day left.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. (infml) a child
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. I am taking the kids (= my children) to the zoo this afternoon.

Vocabularies.Definition: 自始至终，一直
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. I am with you all the way.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 街坊;四邻 e.g. She is well-known in the neighborhood for her charitable（慈善的）work.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: (infml) a little bit, in some way or degree 有几分,有点儿 e.g. It was kind of odd that he didn't come.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: 失去联系
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. I am trying to get in touch with my brother; he emigrated to Australia, and I lost touch with him.

Vocabularies.Definition: 几个;一对，一双 e.g. Across the street there are a couple of police officers standing guard.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 家伙;伙计
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. He's quite a nice guy when you get to know him.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. (infml) unfortunate; difficult; strong 不幸的;困难的;坚固的;坚强的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. The government took tough measures to limit the money supply.

Vocabularies.Definition: 挂记在心头
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. She looks very worried; I wonder what is on her mind.

Vocabularies.Definition: (与...)保持联系，保持接触
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. I haven't really kept in touch with people I knew at school.

Vocabularies.Definition: happen, occur , esp. unexpectedly (尤指意想不到地)发生，出现
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. I'll let you know if anything comes up.

Vocabularies.Definition: v. lift (the shoulders) slightly 耸(肩)
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. She just shrugged (her shoulders), saying she didn't know and didn't care.

Vocabularies.Definition: v.  try very hard to persuade 力劝，催促
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. They urged us to give our support.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. delay 推迟，使延期
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. We're postponing our holiday until August.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 提及，谈到;参考，查阅
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. Use this dictionary for easy reference.

Vocabularies.Definition: ad. completely 完全地,极其 absolute a.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. I'm absolutely starving (= very hungry).

Vocabularies.Definition: n. (家人、朋友、同事等久别后的)重聚
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. We hold an annual reunion of former students of the college.

Vocabularies.Definition: (of time) pass (时间)逝去
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. Two years went by.

Vocabularies.Definition: (infml) stay in or near a place, not doing very much 闲荡;徘徊
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. They normally hang out in the pub.

Vocabularies.Definition: sometimes, at times
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. I write to him every now and then.

Vocabularies.Definition: ad. almost all; generally 几乎全部; 多半，大体
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. She uses her car mostly for driving to work.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.(infml) (used to add force) very great; very bad or unpleasant 非常的, 极大的; 可怕的，糟糕的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. It was awful to see him in such pain.

Vocabularies.Definition: become too upset to speak (因激动等)哽得说不出话;堵塞 choke v. (使)窒息;堵塞
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. Losing my job left me completely choked up; I was so upset that I didn't know what to say.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 目的地
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. The parcel was sent to the wrong destination.

Vocabularies.Definition: v. 略过,跳过;跳跃
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. The speaker kept skipping from one subject to another.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. showing or causing sadness 伤心的，悲伤的 sorrow n.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. We all share your sorrow over this sad loss.

Vocabularies.Definition: far away
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. You can see the ancient ruins in the distance.

Vocabularies.Definition: v. take out (things) from (a suitcase, etc.) 打开
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. Have you unpacked (your clothes/ your suitcase) yet?

Vocabularies.Definition: at once
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. He wants to see you right away.

Vocabularies.Word: Foster Furcolo 福斯特·弗克洛
Parker 帕克(姓氏或男子名)
